results.title: Viva Las Vegas = Love in Las Vegas
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Jack Cummings and George Sidney
results.brief_description: Elvis Presley stars as racing car driver Lucky Jackson, a man determined to win the Las Vegas Grand Prix and triumph over his number one competitor, Count Elmo Mancini (Cesare Danova). The Count is like Lucky in many respects, a determined, thrillseeking ladies man, which makes defeating him even more difficult. To finance his vehicular obsession (and to purchase the most important item - the engine), he performs as a singing waiter, thus giving Elvis the chance to demonstrate his crooning and hip swinging capabilities. The task proves harder than first thought due to the distraction of sexy swimming instructor Rusty Martin (Ann-Margaret), as Lucky faces the prospect of losing love as well as the race. Elvis’ fourteenth movie includes hits such as “The Lady loves me”, “What’d I say”, “C’mon everybody” and “Viva Las Vegas”. Cast also includes Cesare Danova, William Demarest and Nicky Blair. Contains the original theatrical trailer.

results.title: Viridiana
results.creator_credit: Uninci, Films 59, Gustavo Alatriste, Ricardo Munoz Suay and Luis Bunuel
results.brief_description: A novice about to take her vows, who has been abused and cheated by her uncle and his illegitimate son, opens up the former’s house to a collection of cripples and beggars. A savage attack on Catholic mentality and rituals, this powerful psychological study was Bunuel’s first film made in his native Spain for over twenty-five years and his last for many more. Although the script had been unaccountably passed by Franco’s censors, the film itself was banned outright in Spain. The notorious set-piece of ‘The Last Supper’ being enacted by social outcasts also caused the Vatican to condemn it. Cast includes Silvia Pinal, Fernando Rey and Francisco Rabal. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Violent Cop = Sono otoko kyobo ni tsuki (D)
results.creator_credit: Shochiku-Fuji Co, Bandai Visual Company, Kazuyoshi Okuyama and Takeshi Kitano
results.brief_description: Takeshi Kitano’s aptly named “Violent cop” is a sadistic and offbeat exercise in screen violence. Expected comparisons to the gleeful revenge soaked fantasies and moral righteousness of the Dirty Harry series are quickly dissipated by Kitano’s deadpan, morally ambiguous protagonist and the unexpected comic moments sandwiched between the painful and bleak depictions of violence. ‘Beat’ Takeshi plays a hardened cop whose special brand of rough justice lands him in bad favor with his supervisors. Things begin to spiral out of control when he tries to help a corrupt colleague who has become involved with the Yakuza. To make matters worse his mentally unstable sister is also lured into the gang, accumulating into the inevitable bloody showdown. In Japanese with English subtitles Cast also includes Maiko Kawakami, Makoto Ashikawa, Shigeru Hiraizumi and Shiro Sano.

results.title: Village of the damned
results.creator_credit: Wolf Rilla, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Ronald Kinnoch
results.brief_description: From its seemingly placid opening, this tale of an ordinary British village facing an extraordinary foe keeps piling one eerie and disquieting detail upon another, creating an utterly believable masterpiece of horror. The trouble begins when, one normal day a strange supernatural force makes everybody in the village unconscious. When the villagers come to they they find that every capable woman in the village is pregnant. However, all the children are born on the same day and they all look alike - platinum-blonde hair, piercing eyes and the ability to read the unformed thoughts of human beings. Their rapid physical development is matched by their fast-growing mental powers and with calm, blood-curdling efficiency, they are soon terrorising the tiny hamlet - climaxing in an ending which has long-lasting ramifications on the use and misuse of scientific knowledge. Based on the novel “The Midwich cuckoos” by John Wyndham.

results.title: Viking women and the sea serpent
results.creator_credit: American International Pictures (AIP) and Roger Corman
results.brief_description: A group of lonely Viking women build a ship and set off across the sea to locate their missing menfolk who have not returned from an earlier voyage. En route their boat is destroyed and they make their way to an island where they discover the horrors of their beloveds’ fate. Also known as “The Saga of the Viking Women and Their Voyage to the Waters of the Great Sea Serpent” this is a wonderfully bad 1950s ‘creature feature’ by B-movie maestro Roger Corman.

results.title: Victor/Victoria
results.creator_credit: Ladbroke Entertainment, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Blake Edwards and Tony Adams
results.brief_description: Sparkling, ultra-sophisticated entertainment from Blake Edwards. This story is based on a 1933 German comedy film “Viktor und Viktoria” written and directed by Rheinhold Schunzel. Set in Paris in 1934, it is the tale of a down-on-her luck chanteuse, played by Julie Andrews. Also suffering a temporary career lapse is tres gai nightclub entertainer (Robert Preston), who remakes her as a man who in short order becomes celebrated as Paris’s foremost female impersonator. In the process she snags the attentions of a Chicago nightclub owner (James Garner). He, however, has a small problem - is it a he or a she who has stolen his heart? 1982 Academy Award for Best Original Score (Henry Mancini). Academy Award nominations for Best Actress (Julie Andrews), Supporting Actor (Robert Preston), Supporting Actress (Lesley Anne Warren), Screenplay Adaptation, Costume Design and Art Direction.

results.title: Victim
results.creator_credit: Parkway Films, Michael Relph and Basil Dearden
results.brief_description: Dirk Bogarde stars as Melville Farr, a successful lawyer in this film which caused a sensation at its original release. Farr is approached by police who are looking into the theft of money they suspect is being used as payment for blackmail by Jack Barrett (Peter McEnery). Farr initially denies knowing about Barrett because of their previous homosexual relations. Barrett eventually chooses suicide over disclosing the affair and Farr guiltily takes a personal interest in locating the blackmailer. He discovers that Barrett was not the only one being blackmailed, and Barrett must decide between exposing his homosexuality and threatening his career or challenging the legal system that decreed homosexuality a criminal offence and bringing Barrett’s blackmailers to justice. Screenplay by Janet Green and John McCormick. Cast also includes Sylvia Syms, Dennis Price, Anthony Nicholls and Peter McEnery.

results.title: Very bad things
results.creator_credit: Initial Entertainment Group (US), Interscope Communication, Ballpark Productions, Cindy Cowan, Michael Schiffer, Diane Nabatoff and Peter Berg
results.brief_description: Very bad things is a very grim tale of morality and the bond between killers. Kyle Fisher is about to marry Laura, a neurotic, insecure woman, whose wedding plans are being administered by her in a caustic, shrill manner. Kyle’s four best friends - Adam, Michael, Charles and Robert - decide to take him to Vegas for the bucks turn, complete with drugs, booze and strippers. On the night in question one man accidentally kills a prostitute. Encouraged by Robert (Christian Slater) the group decide to bury the body in the desert. Before they can do this however a security guard discovers their crime and is promptly dispatched of also. With two bodies to dispose of the men are drawn into a gruesome pact that will assuredly be their undoing. Upon their return home the friends exchange increasingly bitter and acrimonious accusations as they attempt to deal with their misdeeds. Cameron Diaz plays Laura - the bride who will stop at nothing to have her wedding day perfect, disguising the moral degradation of those around her. Peter Berg makes his directorial debut with this very dark comedy that evokes the spirit of Tarantino, the Coen bothers and Danny Boyle. Also stars: Jeanne Tripplehorn, Daniel Stern and Jon Favreau.

results.title: Vertigo [DVD]
results.brief_description: Arguably one of Hitchcock’s greatest films, “Vertigo” is a tense and riveting film about obsession, desire and betrayal. James Stewart plays a cop with a fear of heights who is hired to keep an eye on the wife (Kim Novak) of an old friend. He falls in love with her, and her tragic death haunts him until he meets another woman who reminds him of her. His obsession with remodelling his new love into the image of the dead woman leads him further and further into a sinister nightmare world in which nothing and no-one is who they seem. With Barbara Bel Geddes and ravishing production credits. Based on “D’Entre les Mortes” by Pierre Boileau and Thomas Narcejac.
